description: VS Code Codex configuration for the GhostRadar multi-board ESP32 firmware project.

presets.title: Run include audit on shared core
presets.prompt: Scan all files under `shared/include` and `shared/src` for include and header discipline issues. Identify circular includes, unnecessary includes, headers that fail to include what they use, and any shared files that include board-specific headers. Provide: (1) a high-level summary, (2) file-by-file findings, and (3) a concrete refactor checklist I can follow. Do not modify any files, only report findings.

presets.title: Add new board from esp_wroom_32 template
presets.prompt: Using `boards/esp_wroom_32` as a reference, create a new board under `boards/<NEW_BOARD_NAME>`. Copy the existing structure (platformio.ini, src/main.cpp, src/BoardConfig.cpp, include/BoardPins.h, data/). Update platformio.ini with the correct PlatformIO board ID, and adjust BoardPins.h and BoardConfig.cpp wiring for the new hardware (display, touch, SD, sensors as described by the user). Keep all hardware-specific details inside the new board folder and do not modify shared code.

presets.title: Refactor shared core subsystem
presets.prompt: Refactor the shared core in `shared/src` and `shared/include` to improve structure, readability, and header discipline for the subsystem specified by the user (e.g. Display, Sensors, Settings). Keep the shared code fully board-agnostic and rely only on BoardConfig.h for hardware abstraction. Output diff-style patches.

presets.title: Implement cross-cutting feature
presets.prompt: Implement a new feature for GhostRadar that may require changes in shared core, one or more boards, PlatformIO configs, and documentation. First, analyze the repository structure, then propose a brief plan. Apply changes in small, coherent steps and output diff-style patches. Respect the rules that shared code must remain board-agnostic and board wiring stays in boards/<board> only.
